terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.inputs.sensors
Class AwtKeyboardModifierSensor

java.lang.Object
  terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.inputs.sensors.AwtKeyboardModifierSensor
public class AwtKeyboardModifierSensor
extends java.lang.Object

An AWT input sensor that monitors a display for modifier key activity. Use setModifiers() to specify which modifier states are recognized. Events are generated only when modifier state changes, and not for key repeats.

Typically, because of the inconsistent handling of modifier key activity by the AWT during drags and the nature of modifier keys in general this sensor should monitor all 3D displays used in the application.

_listener

protected java.awt.event.KeyListener _listener

Method Detail

addEventSource

public void addEventSource(javax.media.j3d.Canvas3D source)
Adds a 3D display as an event source for this sensor.

Parameters:
source - Source display. Never null.

getEventOut

public InputModifierSplitter getEventOut()
Gets the event output splitter. Use it to add and remove event targets.

Returns:
Reference to the event out splitter. Never null.

setModifiers

public void setModifiers(int modifiers)
Sets which modifier states will activate this sensor. This sensor is activated if any of the specified modifier states change.

Parameters:
modifiers - Modifier flags (Input.MODIFIER_???). Defaults to Input.MODIFIER_ALL (which does not include Escape). If MODIFIER_NONE or MODIFIER_IGNORE no events will be generated.

setInputModifier

protected void setInputModifier(int modifier)
Call to send modifier state change.
